intro: Lactuca biennis f. aurea, commonly known as the golden lettuce, is a variant of the biennial lettuce species characterized by its striking golden foliage. This plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features rosettes of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or yellowish hairs. The flowers are typically yellow and arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, slightly bitter taste when eaten.
